title: Performance Thresholds for Autonomous Decision Framework
description: Defines Sharpe ratio and risk thresholds based on industry standards

minimum_viable.description: Below this = ABANDON. Sufficient edge to proceed, but needs optimization
minimum_viable.note: Sharpe 0.0+ shows any positive risk-adjusted return. Optimization may improve to 0.7+

optimization_worthy.note: Sharpe 0.7 = good. Optimization can push to great (1.0+)

production_ready.description: Great performance (Sharpe 1.0+). SKIP optimization, go to validation
production_ready.note: Sharpe 1.0 = great. Skip optimization waste, validate immediately

outstanding_performance.note: Sharpe 1.5 = outstanding. Extremely rare without leverage.

too_perfect_sharpe.reason: Sharpe >2.0 is unreasonable without leverage. Likely overfit.

too_few_trades.reason: Insufficient sample size for statistical significance

win_rate_too_high.reason: Win rate >80% is suspicious. May indicate lookahead bias.

parameter_sensitivity_high.reason: High sensitivity to parameters = not robust

improvement_thresholds.note: Improvement >30% = likely overfit. Improvement >5% = worth validating

robustness_minimum.note: OOS Sharpe should be at least 70% of IS Sharpe

scale.0.0_to_0.7: Subpar to acceptable. Needs optimization or abandonment
scale.0.7_to_1.0: Good. Worth optimizing to reach great (1.0+)
